casebody.data:
Ryal, executor, vs. Morris. 2. That a debtor insisted upon having certain landdines located before paying the note given by him for the purchase money of such land, and the creditor thereupon waited until the note was barred by the statute of limitations, will not relieve the bar of the statute, the note itself being absolute and containing no condition in regard to lines. Speer, Justice, concurred dubitante. Crawford, Justice.

1. A partial payment of a promissory note, to relieve it of the bar of the statute of limitations, must be entered by the debtor or some one authorized by him to do so ; but the creditor is incompetent for that purpose. Code, §2935.
